page.title: 18GLIDING_ HUSBANDS BOSWORTH
page.content: It was first built as an airfield in the 2nd world war,then it was derelict for a while before the Coventry gliding club took over. Most of the gliders there are towed up by small aeroplanes or tractors. They are just towed up until they get high enough then the glider lets go of the rope. It is the same process with the tractors. The chairman of the Gliding Club is Mr.Middleton.Lots of people keep caravans on the airfield and go down for a weekend. Once a year the Gliding Club has an Open Day when anybody can go to the airfield and have a ride in the gliders if they want to.Normally in September there is a rally on the airfield with steam engines and a fair.There is still quite a bit of the original airfield where sheep are grazed.There are some old runways and derelict buildings.
